title: Nagesh vs The State Of Madhya Pradesh on 24 January, 2019
doc:
Nagesh vs The State Of Madhya Pradesh on 24 January, 2019

Equivalent citations: AIRONLINE 2019 MP 66

Author: P.K. Jaiswal

Bench: P.K. Jaiswal

  HIGH COURT OF MADHYA PRADESH : JABALPUR


D. B. : HON. SHRI JUSTICE P.K. JAISWAL &
        HON. SHRI JUSTICE RAJENDRA KUMAR SRIVASTAVA


                  Criminal Appeal No.1389/2007

                          Nagesh and others
                                Versus
                       State of Madhya Pradesh


----------------------------------------------------------------------------
PRESENCE :

               Shri Sanjeev Kumar Singh, learned counsel for the
               appellants.
               Shri B.D. Singh, learned Public Prosecutor
               for the respondent/State.

                  Criminal Appeal No.1318/2007

                               Bhagwan
                                Versus
                       State of Madhya Pradesh


----------------------------------------------------------------------------
PRESENCE :

               Shri Sanjeev Kumar Singh, learned counsel for the
               appellants.
               Shri B.D. Singh, learned Public Prosecutor
               for the respondent/State.
---------------------------------------------------------------------------
                                2



                       JUDGMENT

(24/01/2019) Per P.K. Jaiswal, J.

Appellants have filed these two appeals under Section 374(2) of the Code of Criminal Procedure, 1973 assailing the impugned judgment passed by Additional Sessions Judge, Burhanpur in Sessions Trial No.275/2006. Since all these appeals are arising out of same incident, therefore, they are heard together and are being decided by this common judgment.

2. Appellant-Bhagwan in Criminal Appeal No.1318/2007 and appellant No.1-Nagesh, appellant No.2-Jasram, appellant No.3-Mohandas, appellant No.4-Ateesh, appellant No.5-Hukum, appellant No.6- Om and appellant No.7-Hiralal in Criminal Appeal No.1389/2007 were tried under Sections 147, 148, 302, 307/149 (on two counts), 307/149, 323/149 of IPC. The appellant-Bhagwan in Criminal Appeal No.1318/2007 and appellant No.2 and 3 in Criminal Appeal No.1389/2007 were tried also under Section 25 (1-B)(b) of the Arms Act. 1959 for committing murder of 3 deceased-Jai and causing injuries to injured Vijay (PW-

1), Raja (PW-2) and Ajay (PW-3).

3. The trial Court convicted all of them under Sections 148 of IPC and sentenced to three years RI with fine of Rs.500/- each, in default of payment of fine, further RI for three months each, under Section 302/149 of IPC and sentenced to life imprisonment with fine of Rs.1,000/- each, in default of payment of fine, further RI for one year each, under Section 307/149 of IPC (two count) and sentenced to seven years RI with fine of Rs.500/- each, in default of payment of fine, further RI for six months (two count) each, under Section 323/149 of IPC and sentenced to six months RI with fine of Rs.200/-each, in default of payment of fine, further RI for one month each. Appellant No.2-Jasram and appellant No.3-Mohandas in Criminal Appeal No.1389/2007 are also convicted under Section 25 (1- B)(b) of Arms Act and sentenced to three years RI with fine of Rs.500/- each, in default of payment of fine, further RI for three months each and that all the sentences shall run concurrently.

4

4. Eight accused were tried and convicted by the impugned judgment. They were before us as appellants in these two appeals.

5. The case of the prosecution, in brief, is that on 15/09/2006 at about 9.45 p.m. in the night, Jai, brother of Vijay (PW-1) after taking meal at Daulatpura Sweeper Colony, Burhanpur was returning to his quarter for sleeping and when he reached in front of house of accused-Bhagwandas, due to old enmity accused Bahgwandas, Mohandas and Ateesh armed with sword, Jasram with knife, Hukum with iron rod, Nagesh and Hiralal with wooden stick surrounded him and started inflicting injuries to him. Accused Ateesh and Jasram caused sword injuries to him due to which he fell down. Narendra (PW-4), Bhagat (not examined) and Malla (PW-5) reached at the spot and witnessed the incident. Apart from them, number of persons of the locality had witnessed the incident. Complainant Vijay (PW-1) along with his brother Raja (PW-2) went to Police Station Shikarpura to lodge the report. Immediately thereafter the police personnel reached at the place of 5 occurrence and sent the injured-Jai to hospital along with Vijay (PW-1), Raja (PW-2) and Ajay (PW-3) for treatment. On the same night Jai died and on the basis of death intimation, Marg was registered and Section 302 of IPC was added.

6. During the course of investigation, Police prepared spot map, seized blood stained earth and ordinary earth from the place of occurrence, deceased was sent for post-mortem, appellants were arrested on 16/09/2006, their memorandum was recorded. From accused-Nagesh one lathi, accused-Jasram one blood stained knife, appellant Mohandas one blood stained sword, accused-Ateesh one blood stained sword, accused-Hukum one blood stained iron rod, accused- Om one bamboo stick, accused Bhagwan one blood stained sword and accused-Hiralal one bamboo stick were seized. Police statement of Vijay, Raja, Ajay, Naarendra, Malla, Santosh, Babita and Koyal were recorded. After investigation, charge sheet was filed before the Judicial Magistrate First Class, who, in turn, committed the case to the Court of Session, Burhanpur 6 from where it was received on transfer by the Additional Sessions Judge, Burhanpur, who conducted the trial.

7. Prosecution, in all, examined 16 witnesses; out of them Vijay (PW-1), Raja (PW-2) and Ajay (PW-3) are injured witnesses of the case. Narendra (PW-4), Malla (PW-5) and Koyal (PW-6) are independent eye witnesses. Dilip (PW-7) is the witness of seizure, R.K. Sonkar (PW-12) is Investigating Officer, Dr. Rakesh Chouksey (PW-9) is treating doctor and Dr. Umesh Vyas (PW-10) is Autopsy Surgeon. All the injured and eye witnesses supported the case of the prosecution.

8. The trial Court after appreciating the ocular and medical evidence convicted all the appellants at stated in para-3.

9. Learned counsel for the appellants has drawn our attention to the statement of injured and independent eye witnesses, the omissions and contradictions recorded therein and submitted that out of ten injuries of deceased, 7 and 8 injuries are simple in nature and rest all are caused by hard and sharp object. He further pointed out that both the injuries of injured Vijay (PW- 7

1) is simple in nature. Another injured Raja (PW-2) has sustained three injuries, injury No.1 and 2 are simple in nature and for third injury he was advised to x-ray. He also draw our attention on the medical evidence and submitted that Ajay (PW-3) has not sustained any injury. Appellants-Jasram, Mohandas, Ateesh and Bhagwan have completed more than 11 years of jail sentence and appellants-Nagesh, Hukum, Om and Hiralal have also completed more than 10 years of jail sentence. No injuries by hard and blunt object was found on the person of the deceased, therefore, they have been released on bail. He also pointed out that there was no light at the place of occurrence. It is a case of false implication due to old enmity with complainant party the present appellants have been implicated in the alleged offence and made a prayer for undergone on behalf of appellant No.1-Nagesh, appellant No.5- Hukum,appellant No.6-Om and appellant No.7-Hiralal of Criminal Appeal No.1389/2007. In respect of other appellants, he prayed for their acquittal. 8

10. Shri B.D. Singh, learned Public Prosecution has drawn our attention to the statement of injured and eyewitnesses and submitted that all the witnesses have supported the case of prosecution. He has also pointed out that from entire evidence including ocular testimony of Vijay (PW-1), Raja (PW-2), Narendra (PW-4), Malla (PW-5) and Koyal (PW-6), prosecution has proved its case beyond reasonable doubt against the appellants. The trial Court has rightly convicted the appellants and prayed for dismissal of both these appeals.

11. We have heard learned counsel for the parties and perused the record.

12. As per statement of Dr.Rakesh Chouksey (PW-9), on 15/09/2006 at about 10.45 p.m. in the night when injured Jai was taken in the hospital, he was medically examined by him. At that time, he was unconscious, his condition was very critical and blood was oozing from nose and both ears. Ex.P/32 is the MLC report and as per MLC report, following injuries are found on the person of the deceased :

9

"(1) Incise wound oblique placed 5" x 1". Brain conj out the wound. (2) Incise wound 4' x 1". Bone deep left frontal area vertical placed. (3) Incise would 3" x 1"x ½" middle of forehead, horizontal placed. (4) Incise wound 1 ½" x ½" one deep right side of forehead oblique placed. (5) Incise wound 1 ½" x 1 ½". Bone deep 1 ½" above injury No.4 right parietal area.
(6) Incise wound 1 ½" x ½". Bone deep parallel ½" medial to injury No.2. (7) Incise wound 1" x ½" x muscle deep left foot.
(8) Incise wound ½" x ½" muscle deep left leg. 
      (9)   Incise      wound    right     parietal
      eminence 2" x ½". Bone deep oblique
      placed.
      (10) Incise wound behind right ear 2 ½
      x 1/2" bone deep."
Injury No.7 and 8 are of simple in nature and rest of the injuries are by hard and sharp object. He also examined injured Raja (PW-2). Ex.P/33 is his MLC 10 report. As per MLC report, he sustained follwoign three injuries :
"(1) Red abrasion 1"x1/2" right wrist. (2) Rad abrasion 5" x 1/8" right side of thigh outer.
(3) Mild swelling 1" x ½" right parietal area."

Injury No.1 and 2 are simple in nature and for injury No.3 which was on head, he was advised for x- ray and referred to Surgeon.

13. Ex.P/34 is the MLC of injured Vijay (PW-2) who sustained following injuries :

(1) Lacerated wound 3" x 1". Bone deep on front parietal oozing blood. Black right eye, (2) Lacerated wound right arm outer surface 1 ½"x ¼"x ¼" oblique placed blooding was oozing."

Both the injuries are of simple in nature and by hard and blunt object.

11

14. Ex.P/35 is the MLC of injured Ajay (PW-3) who following injuries :

"Mild tenderness present in left knee, left thigh lower part, movement normal."

The injuries caused by hard and blunt object. Both injuries are simple in nature.

15. During intervening night on 15/09/2006 and 16/09/2006 injured Jai died and intimation of his death was given to Police Help Centre, Nehru Hospital Chowki vide Ex.P/36. Dr. Rakesh Choukse (PW-9) also replied the query dated 30/09/2006 and was of the opinion that the injuries of Jai were caused by two swords. In respect of two other injured, he has deposed that injuries of injured were caused by hard and blunt object and cannot be shown in the report. Ex.P/37 is query report dated 05/10/2006. After death, deceased was sent for post-mortem. Post-mortem of the deceased was conducted by Dr. Umesh Vyas (PW-10). Ex.P/39 is the post-mortem report. As per post-mortem report, deceased sustained following injuries : 12

"Multiple stitches wound eight in number over scalp size varies from 4"

to 1" on parietal, frontal behind right ear and forehead. Stitched wound on left feet 1". stitched wound on left foot 2". On opening scalp fracture of frontal bone extending to parietal bone about 8". Brain matter behind fracture crush and haemotoma at that side. Bleeding from right ear.

Cause of death was due to injury to vital organ i.e. brain.

16. As per statement of Dr.Rakesh Chouksey (PW-9) and Dr. Umesh Vyas (PW-10), all the injuries were antemortem and death is homicidal.

17. Injured Vijay(PW-1),in his statement, has deposed that on 15/09/2006 when Jai after taking meal was going to his quarter and reached near the house of appellant-Bhagwan then he saw that all the accused persons armed with deadly weapons surrounded him 13 and started inflicting injuries to him. He called Raja (PW-2) and Ajay (PW-3) who immediately rushed to the place of occurrence. When Raja (PW-2_ and Ajay (PW-

3) were trying to save him, appellants-Mohandas and Ateesh inflicted sword injuries to them. Hirala, Nagesh and Om also inflicted injury to deceased on his head, blood was oozing and they have also inflicted wooden injuries on the person of Raja (PW-2) and Ajay (PW-3). As per statement of Vijay (PW-1), after some time Naraendra (PW-4), Malla (PW-5, Rajaram (PW-2) along with number of persons came at the place of occurrence. Raja (PW-2) supported the version of Vijay (PW-1) and stated that appellants -Bhagwan, Jasram caused sword and knife injuries on the head of the deceased due to which deceased fell down and when his brother Vijay (PW-1) came to save him, Mohandas and Ateesh caused sword injuries to his brother. Appellants-Nagesh, Om and Hiralal caused wooden injuries to Vijay (PW-1), some how Vijay (PW-1) saved his life and went to Police Station.

14

18. As per statement of Ajay (PW-3), accused- Bhagwan and Jasram inflicted sword and kinfe injuries to deceased Jai and due to which, Mohandas inflicted sword injuries on the head of Vijay (PW-1) and Ateesh inflicted sword injuries on his hand. He has also deposed that accused-Om, Hiralal, Nagesh also assaulted him. Accused -Hukum inflicted injuries on the foot of this witness by iron rod. As per statement of Raja (PW-2) and Ajay (PW-3) there was old enmity between complainant partyand appellants-Bhagwan and Mohandas.

19. Narendra (PW-4) and Malla (PW-5), in their statement, have deposed that on 15/09/2006 at about 9.00 to 9.30 p.m. in the night when they were watching T.V. along with Babita, on hearing shriek they came from the house and saw that near the house of Prakash all the accused persons were causing injuries to deceased. Accused-Bhagwan, Mohan, Ateesh were armed with sword, accused Jasram armed with knife, accused-Hukum armed with iron rod, accused-Hira, Nagesh and Om were armed with lathi. All accused 15 persons were causing injuries to the deceased-Jai due to which he fell down and when Vijay (PW-1), Raja (PW-

2) and Ajay (PW-3) intervened and tried to rescue the deceased, they also caused injuries to them. Malla (PW-5), Koyal (PW-6) also supported the case of prosecution. Vijay (PW-1), in his statement, has deposed that there was no light, Raja (PW-2) and Ajay (PW-3) have stated that there was sufficient light at the place of occurrence. It is also on record that one criminal case under Section 307 of IPC was registered against the complainant party i.e. Ajay, Raja, Deep, Prem and deceased-Jai for causing injuries to appellants-Mohandas, Ateesh, Geeta Bai, Rekha Bai and Kalpana.

20. As per FSL report (Ex.P/52), no human blood was found. As per statement of Vijay (PW-1), the allegation against appellant No.1-Nagesh, appellant No.5-Hukum, appellant No.6-Om and appellant No.7- Hiralal is of causing lathi injury to him as well as Raja and Ajay which are simple in nature. Only omnibus allegation has been made against these four appellants. 16 Similar is the statement of injured Vijay (PW-1), Raja (PW-2), Ajay (PW-3), Narendra (PW-4), Malla (PW-5) and Koyal (PW-6) who are independent prosecution witnesses. Narendra (PW-4) in para-6 and 7 of his statement has deposed that he has seen that number of persons were armed with deadly weapon and lathi. When he came from his house, he saw that deceased-Jai was lying on the field. Police Statement (Ex.D/4) of this witness was recorded after 15-20 days from the date of incident. Police Statement of Koyal (PW-6) was recorded after 20 days from the date of incident. All the material prosecution witnesses in their statement have deposed that the complainant party and the appellants were having inimical relations from the last two years. Against appellant No.1-Nagesh, appellant No.5- Hukum, appellant No.6-Om and appellant No.7-Hiralal there is no direct allegation of causing fatal injury to the deceased.

21. There is evidence on record to show that deceased was attacked by Appellants-Jasram, Mohandas, Ateesh and Bhagwan who were armed with knife and sword. 17 Though Vijay (PW-1), Raja (PW-2) and Ajay (PW-3) were related to the deceased, their evidence in respect of knife and sword is credible and trustworthy. Medical evidence of Dr. Rakesh Choukse (PW-9) and Dr. Umesh Vyas (PW-10) corroborates the oral testimony of the prosecution witnesses. We are in agreement with the findings of trial Court. We also do not find any fault with the finding recorded by the trial Court that the death of Jai was caused due to the injury caused by Jasram, Mohandas, Ateesh and Bhagwan. They attacked the deceased with knife and sword and caused multiple injuries by sharp and hard object which resulted in death. Appellants Nagesh, Hukum, Om and Hiralal assisted them in committing the crime by surrounding the deceased. However, the only question that falls for our consideration is whether the appellants- Nagesh, Hukum, Om and Hiralal are liable to be punished for an offence under Section 302 of IPC.

22. After considering the submissions made by the counsel for the appellants and scrutinising the material on record, we are of the opinion that appellant No.1- 18 Nagesh, appellant No.5-Hukum, appellant No.6-Om and appellant No.7-Hiralal are not liable to be convicted under Section 302 of IPC. We are convinced that there was neither prior concert nor common intention to form an unlawful assembly to commit murder. As we are convinced that accused Jasram, Mohandas, Ateesh and Bhagwan were responsible for death of Jai, we are of the opinion that they are liable to be convicted and, therefore, their conviction is maintained.

23. There is murder of one by accused Jasram, Mohandas, Ateesh and Bhagwan and injuries of three persons [Vijay (PW-1), Raja (PW-2) and Ajay (PW-3)] in the attack by appellant No.1-Nagesh, appellant No.5- Hukum, appellant No.6-Om and appellant No.7-Hiralal. The occurrence was a result of an enmity. Appellant No.1-Nagesh, appellant No.5-Hukum, appellant No.6- Om and appellant No.7-Hiralal have completed more than 10 years of jail sentence. Thus, looking to the inflicted injuries caused by appellant No.1-Nagesh, appellant No.5-Hukum, appellant No.6-Om and 19 appellant No.7-Hiralal, we are of the view that they are not liable to be convicted under Section 302 of IPC.

24. In the present case, appellant No.1-Nagesh, appellant No.5-Hukum, appellant No.6-Om and appellant No.7-Hiralal of Criminal Appeal No.1389/2007 were the members of unlawful assembly. From the evidence of injured and eye witnesses, it is established that murder of deceased-Jai was committed by appellant No.2-Jasram, appellant No.3-Mohandas, appellant No.3-Mohandas, Appellant No.4-Ateesh of Criminal Appeal No.1389/2007 and appellant-Bhagwan of Criminal Appeal No.1318/2007. As common object of unlawful assembly to attack the complainant and others is proved, considering the manner of attack and stick used in committing the crime, we are of the view that appellant No.1-Nagesh, appellant No.5-Hukum, appellant No.6-Om and appellant No.7-Hiralal of Criminal Appeal No.1389/2007 are guilty of offence under Sections 147, 148, 307/149 (on two counts), 307/149 and 323/149 of IPC. They have already undergone a sentence of more than 10 years. The 20 incident occurred in the year 2006 and that there is no complaint from either side about any further violence since then, sentence limited to the period already undergone.

25. In the result, conviction of appellant No.1- Nagesh, appellant No.5-Hukum, appellant No.6-Om and appellant No.7-Hiralal of Criminal Appeal No.1389/2007 under Section 302 of IPC is modified as conviction under Sections 147, 148, 307/149 (on two counts), 307/149 and 323/149 of IPC and the sentence is reduced to the period already undergone and the appeal is partly allowed accordingly. The appellant No.5- Hukum of Criminal Appeal No.1389/2007 is hereby ordered to be set at liberty forthwith, if he is not required to be detained in connection with any other case. Appellant No.1- Nagesh, appellant No.6-Om and appellant No.7-Hiralal of Criminal Appeal No.1389/2007 are on bail, their bail bonds are hereby discharged.

26. In view of aforesaid discussion, the Criminal Appeal No.1389/2007 filed on behalf of appellant No.2- 21 Jasram, appellant No.3-Mohandas, appellant No.4- Ateesh and Criminal Appeal No.1318/2007 filed on behalf of appellant-Bhagwan are hereby dismissed and their conviction is hereby maintained.





(P.K. JAISWAL)           (RAJENDRA KUMAR SRIVASTAVA)
    JUDGE                         JUDGE

ts

Digitally signed by TULSA SINGH
Date: 2019.01.25 16:35:46 +05'30'
